page.title: 14Local News Summer 1985
page.content: Pupils at Maghull C of E Primary School did the following survey. {Lydiate Hall}was built in the 15th century and was open to the public for the first time this century.The hall is just off Liverpool Road and has lain in ruins for years.In 1984 the Merseyside Archaeological Society started to excavate in an attempt to clear and date the building.Guided tours were available and finds were on display. {The Unsworth Chapel}opened its doors to the public in July 1985.The building dates back to the 13th century,it is named after the Unsworth family and is for the use of any Christian. {Maghull Judo Club}was burnt to ruins this summer.Nobody knows the cause but the fire destroyed hundreds of pounds worth of kits and equipment.
